result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alberto E Rivera in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Alberto E Rivera in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Sentencing. Court ordered bail to be returned to person who posted for Gitonna Jernigan, defaulting witness.
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Additional statements made by Delilah R. and Kimberly H. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to Counts 2 & 3. CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of life in prison. Court ordered defendant is not eligible for extended supervision. 
  
AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 30 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to Count 2.  CONFINEMENT of 20 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 4:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 30 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, concurrent with Counts 1, 2, 3 & 5.  CONFINEMENT of 20 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 5:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 30 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons concurrent with Counts 1, 2, 3 & 4.  CONFINEMENT of 20 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS.

All counts are consecutive to any other sentences. 

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs; DNA surcharge.
-Restitution is set at ZERO. 
-No contact with victim, victims family or anyone related to this case.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel. 

The defendant is remanded into the custody of the Sheriff. Report to Dodge.

FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Written Explanation of Determinate Life Sentence.
Defense request sentencing be rescheduled. Parties agree case rescheduled for sentencing on 10-18-2017 at 8:15 am, branch 38.
Request for payment of $17.00 witness fees for witness Claudia D. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x25486801 in court 1x.

Witness fee request prepared for Claudia D. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Jury Questions, received and filed. tk
Exhibit List- Jury Trial 07-10-2017, received and filed. tk

Defendant Alberto E Rivera in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Alberto E Rivera in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner and Jennifer Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin, with in court officer Detective Hurley. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
At the hour of 1:03 pm the jury notified the court they have reached a verdict. At the hour of 1:37 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to all 5 charges which was then read.  

"We, the jury, find the defendant, Alberto Rivera, GUILTY of Felon in Possession of a Firearm, in the manner and form as charged in Count 1 of the information."  
"We, the jury, find the defendant, Alberto Rivera, GUILTY of First Degree Intentional Homicide, in the manner and form as charged in Count 2 of the information."  Did the defendant or a person the defendant was a party to a crime with commit the offense of First Degree Intentional Homcide while using a dangerous weapon? YES.
"We, the jury, find the defendant, Alberto Rivera, GUILTY of Attempted First Degree Intentional Homicide, in the manner and form as charged in Count 3 of the information."  Did the defendant or a person the defendant was a party to a crime with commit the offense of Attempted First Degree Intentional Homcide while using a dangerous weapon? YES.
"We, the jury, find the defendant, Alberto Rivera , GUILTY of Armed Robbery, in the manner and form as charged in Count 4 of the information."
"We, the jury, find the defendant, Alberto Rivera , GUILTY of Armed Robbery, in the manner and form as charged in Count 5 of the information."
Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed. 

At the hour of 1:39 pm jury dismissed for the day.

Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. 
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Court ordered a presentence investigation without a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 09-08-07 at 8:15, branch 38.

Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror (#21) selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:08 to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Spottek and Sanflippo who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury Question received at 11:15 am.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2017 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Alberto E Rivera not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In chambers conference held.  Case to remain in trial posture.  Possible spin court may have been located.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Alberto E Rivera not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is serving an 8 year revocation sentence at Columbia Correctional.  Matter is currently set for jury trial on 3-27-2017, however, the court will not be in session March 29-31.  The state is requesting that a spin court be located or a reserve judge be brought in so that the trial date may be maintained.  The state's essential witness/victim suffers severe emotional distress each time this case is adjourned for trial.  The court will set the matter over for status on 3-16-2017 to check on availability of a spin.  Status conference scheduled for March 16, 2017 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Alberto E Rivera in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Defendant Alberto E Rivera in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is currently serving a sentencing at Dodge Correctional.  This matter is currently set for jury trial on 9-12-2016.  Case has been set for trial 3 prior times.  The state is requesting an adjournment of the trial as it informed the court on the last date that its primary detective will be on vacation and out of state the week of the trial.  The defendant objects to another adjournment of the trial.  The court provides the state an opportunity to review police reports to determine which other officers would be available to serve as its court officer for the trial.  ADA Huebner states that due to a trial this week and next he will need at least 2 weeks to review the reports.  The state informs the court and counsel that without Det. Ann Phillippi available for the week of the trial it will be necessary for the state to call additional witnesses which may ultimately extend the length of the trial.  The trial date of 9-12-2016 is to stand.
Signed and filed.
